description:
:MARC: ``595``,``859``,``916``
Only the first source is stored: if the record later gets enriched with
metadata coming from a second source, the `acquisition_source` is not
updated.

datetime.description:
:MARC: `916__w``,`595__a (with certain conditions)``
This does not necessarily coincide with the creation date of the
record, as there might be some delay between the moment the
original information is obtained and a record is finally created in
the system.
datetime.title: Date on which the metadata was obtained

email.description:
:MARC: ``859``
This only gets populated when `method` is `submitter`.
email.title: Email address associated to the submitter's account

internal_uid.description: This only gets populated when `method` is `submitter`.
internal_uid.title: Inspire user ID of the submitter

method.description:
Possible values are:
`submitter`
    when obtained from a user submission. In this case, `orcid`,
    `internal_uid` and `email` store identifiers of the submitter,
    and `submission_number` an ID of the submission. The submitter can be the cataloger.
`oai`
    when obtained by OAI-PMH harvesting.
`batchuploader`
    when obtained through the batch uploader.
`hepcrawl`
    when obtained from a hepcrawl crawler. In this case, `source`
    stores the publisher or the repository that was crawled.
method.title: Data obtaining method

orcid.description: This only gets populated when `method` is `submitter`.
orcid.title: ORCID of the submitter

submission_number.description: This only gets populated when `method` is `submitter`.
submission_number.title: Holding pen record ID of the submission

title: Origin of the metadata in the record
